actions.text: Referred to the House Committee on Energy and Commerce.

official_title: To provide for the development and dissemination of programs and materials for training pharmacists, health care providers, and patients on the circumstances under which a pharmacist may decline to fill a prescription for a controlled substance because the pharmacist suspects the prescription is fraudulent, forged, or otherwise indicative of abuse or diversion, and for other purposes.
short_title: Empowering Pharmacists in the Fight Against Opioid Abuse Act

titles.title: Empowering Pharmacists in the Fight Against Opioid Abuse Act

To provide for the development and dissemination of programs and materials for training pharmacists, health care providers, and patients on the circumstances under which a pharmacist may decline to fill a prescription for a controlled substance because the pharmacist suspects the prescription is fraudulent, forged, or otherwise indicative of abuse or diversion, and for other purposes.
